summary: RECALL 17V-162.  THIS RECALL ONLY TIGHTENS FASTENERS ON WIPER ASSY.  IT DOES NO ADDITIONAL REPAIRS.  MY WIPERS BLADES FELL APART WHILE DRIVING IN HEAVY RAIN ON INTERSTATE 90.  DEALER WOULD ONLY REPLACE ENTIRE WIPER ASSEMBLY FOR $500+.  THEY WOULD NOT REPLACE INDIVIDUAL PARTS OR SELL ME INDIVIDUAL PARTS.  THERE WAS A BROKEN PART CALLED A CRANK ARM.  I HAD THE BROKEN PART WELDED AND REASSEMBLED THE SYSTEM. THE WIPER TIMING STILL DOES NOT WORK RIGHT IN HEAVY RAIN AND WIND.  THE RECALL IS WORTHLESS.
2014 FORD THOR HURRICANE E-450.  CONSUMER WRITES IN REGARDS TO DEFECTIVE WINDSHIELD WIPERS AND SEEKS REIMBURSEMENT FOR REPAIRS.  *LD *JS

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 THOR HURRICANE RV. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE RV WAS EXHIBITING ELECTRICAL ISSUES AND CAUSING THE ENGINE TO LOSE POWER. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC HOWEVER, THE TECHNICIAN WAS UNABLE TO DIAGNOSE A FAILURE BUT REPLACED THE BATTERY. THE FAILURE PERSISTED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 1,490 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 2,240. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE.
